text: The Divisiones Regionales de Fútbol in the Community of Castile and León: *Primera División Regional Aficionados (Level 5) *Primera División Provincial Aficionados (Level 6) *Segunda División Provincial Aficionados (Level 7) ==League chronology== Timeline - Ávila * Timeline - Burgos Timeline - León Timeline - Palencia Timeline - Salamanca Timeline - Segovia * Timeline - Soria * Timeline - Valladolid Timeline - Zamora ==Primera Regional== Primera Regional is the fifth level of competition of the Spanish Football League in the Community of Castile and León. ===The league === The Primera División Regional is played in two groups of 18 teams. At the end of the season, the champion of each group and the best runner-up are promoted. Bottom four teams from Group A and bottom three from Group B are relegated to Primera División Provincial Aficionado. Further teams may be relegated to maintain a league of 36 teams. ===2019–20 teams=== ====Group A==== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! width=200|Club ! width=200|City ! width=80|Founded ! width=250| |- |Briviesca||Briviesca||—||align=center|'''''' |- |Cebrereña||Cebreros||1949||align=center|'''''' |- |Uxama||El Burgo de Osma||—||align=center|'''''' |- |Colegios Diocesanos||Ávila||2014||align=center|3rd |- |Villarcayo Nela||Villarcayo de Merindad de Castilla la Vieja||1972||align=center|4th |- |Unami||Segovia||1983||align=center|5th |- |Castilla Palencia||Palencia||1929||align=center|6th |- |Villamuriel||Villamuriel de Cerrato||1977||align=center|7th |- |San José||Soria||1978||align=center|8th |- |Racing Lermeño||Lerma||1969||align=center|9th |- |Tardelcuende||Tardelcuende||—||align=center|10th |- |Calasanz||Soria||1986||align=center|11th |- |Atlético Palencia 1929||Palencia||2013||align=center|12th |- |Turégano||Turégano||—||align=center|'''''' |- |Carejas Paredes||Paredes de Nava||—||align=center|'''''' |- |Internacional Vista Alegre||Burgos||—||align=center|'''''' |- |Atlético Candeleda||Candeleda||1977||align=center|'''''' |- |San Esteban de Gormaz||San Esteban de Gormaz||—||align=center|'''''' |} ====Group B==== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! The nine provincial champions are promoted to Primera División Regional. There are relegations to Segunda Provincial de Aficionados in four provinces; Segovia, León (3 clubs), Valladolid (3 clubs) and Zamora. ===2019–20 teams=== ====Group Ávila==== {| class="wikitable sortable" ! width=200|Club ! width=200|City ! width=80|Founded ! width=250| |- |Fresno de La Ribera||Fresno de la Ribera||—||align=center|2nd |- |Toresana||Toro||—||align=center|3rd |- |Villalpando||Villalpando||—||align=center|4th |- |Coreses||Coreses||—||align=center|5th |- |Morales del Vino Atlético||Morales del Vino||—||align=center|6th |- |Villaralbo B||Villaralbo||—||align=center|7th |- |Sporting Zamora||Zamora||—||align=center|8th |- |Racing Benavente||Benavente||—||align=center|9th |- |Atlético Zamora||Zamora||—||align=center|10th |- |Camarzana y Los Valles||Camarzana de Tera||—||align=center|11th |- |San Cristóbal||San Cristóbal de Entreviñas||—||align=center|12th |- |Santa Croya||Santa Croya de Tera||—||align=center|13th |} ==Segunda Provincial== ===The League=== The Segunda Provincial is played in four provinces Segovia, León, Valladolid (3 groups) and Zamora in six groups of 12 to 20 teams. The top three clubs form León and the three group winners from Valladolid are promoted to Primera División Provincial Aficionado. ===Some teams playing in this level=== *Hullera Vasco-Leonesa ==External links== *Federación de Castilla y León de Fútbol *Fútbolme Category:Divisiones Regionales de Fútbol Category:Football in Castile and León Category:Sports competitions in Castile and León
